workflow.name: Select and Schedule Firmware Update by Network Tag
workflow.title: Select and Schedule Firmware Update by Network Tag

properties.name: Network List
properties.description: List of Networks with firmware upgrades scheduled

properties.name: Network Counter
properties.description: A count of the number of Networks found with the required Tag

properties.name: Not Scheduled List
properties.description: List of Networks where the Update NEtwork Firmware Upgrade API call failed

properties.name: Network Tag
properties.description: Network Tag

properties.name: Organization Counter
properties.description: A count of the number of Organizations found that have at least one Network with the required Tag

Custom Workflow by enovak that takes a Network Tag as input and then pauses with a User Prompt to select firmware versions for Appliance, Switch, and Wireless devices and the date and time to for the firmware update.  (User Prompts are found on the dashboard under Automation -> User Tasks -> Prompts) After the User Prompt has been submitted, the Workflow continues and loops through all networks that have the supplied Network Tag from all Organizations the selected Meraki Key has access to and schedules the firmware upgrades.
NOTE: If over 500 Networks are found with a matching Network Tag, the workflow will fail with the run status of workflow_timeout due to the current limitation of only 500 iterations in a single For Each loop. See the example on using nested loops to workaround this current limitiation.
properties.display_name: Select and Schedule Firmware Update by Network Tag

NOTE: This condition branch check activity could be deleted, it is left in this example to provide a placeholder for the logic explanation.

Get the available firmware versions from the first Network in the Network Table.
NOTE: The assumption here is that all Networks with the same tag are alike and that the firmware versions available for one represent the firmware versions that are available for all.  If this is not the case for you, you may want to modify this activity to specify the Network to use to identify the available firmware versions.

actions.name: Group
actions.title: Format the firmware data for the User Prompt

properties.description:
This group of activities gets the current firmware versions, available versions short names and version IDs and formats the data into JSON arrays.  It utilizes multiple Python Script activities that could be combined into a single activity.  
NOTE: You can duplicate the activities and make very minor modifications to use them for additional device types
properties.display_name: Format the firmware data for the User Prompt

actions.name: JSONPath Query
actions.title: Get the current and available version short names

properties.description:
JSONPath Query to get the current and available version short names and available version IDs.
NOTE: You can add additional JSON Path Queries here for additional product types
properties.display_name: Get the current and available version short names

properties.description: Custom Python Script activity that converts the strings from the preceding JSON PathQuery into JSON Arrays to be used in the User Prompt activity drop-down selections.
properties.script:
import json
import ast

def convert_to_json_array(input_string):
    """
    Converts an input (stringified list, list, or single value) into a proper JSON array.
    """

    # If it's already a list (not a string), return it
    if isinstance(input_string, list):
        return json.dumps(input_string, indent=4)

    # Clean and prepare the string
    input_string = str(input_string).strip()

    # Strip outer quotes if present
    if (input_string.startswith('"') and input_string.endswith('"')) or \
       (input_string.startswith("'") and input_string.endswith("'")):
        input_string = input_string[1:-1]

    try:
        # Try to parse it as a list
        parsed_list = ast.literal_eval(input_string)
        if isinstance(parsed_list, list):
            return json.dumps(parsed_list, indent=4)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # Fallback: treat it as a single string item
    return json.dumps([input_string], indent=4)

# Convert the strings to a JSON array
appliance_available_versions_shortnames = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Appliance available version short names$')
appliance_available_versions_ids = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Appliance available version IDs$')
switch_available_versions_shortnames = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Switch available version short names$')
switch_available_versions_ids = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Switch available version IDs$')
wireless_available_versions_shortnames = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Wireless available version short names$')
wireless_available_versions_ids = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02NZNG3C7V0F769SnZOGmn9nOLjjP4QA5z6.output.jsonpath_queries.Wireless available version IDs$')

properties.description: Set the local variables that will be used in the following User Prompt activity

This creates a User Prompt where the user will select the firmware versions from the drop down selection of available versions and the date and time for the firmware upgrade to be scheduled for.
NOTE: The User Prompt is found at Automation -> User Tasks -> Prompts

actions.name: Group
actions.title: Format the selected firmware version IDs

properties.description:
This group of activities will get the version IDs from the selected version Short Names.  
NOTE: This could be done in a single Python Script activity.  In this example, multiple activities are used, one for each product type.  To add additional product types, just duplicate a Python script activity and modify it to support the new product type
properties.display_name: Format the selected firmware version IDs

properties.description: Set the local variables to the values selected by the user in the User Prompt activity

actions.name: Execute Python Script
actions.title: Get Selected Version IDs from Short Names

properties.description:
A custom Python Script activity that provides a function that takes two arrays (key, value) and a target value and returns the value from the value array that corresponds to the entry in the key array that matches the value provided in the target value argument.
NOTE: To add support for new product types just add a line for the new product passing in the appropriate arguments.
properties.display_name: Get Selected Version IDs from Short Names
properties.script:
import json

def find_matching_value(key_array, value_array, target):
    if target in key_array:
        index = key_array.index(target)
        return value_array[index]
    else:
        return None  # Or raise an error if preferred

# Run the function and print the result
selected_appliance_version_id = find_matching_value($activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Appliance Available Version Short Names$, $activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Appliance Available Version IDs$, "$activity.definition_activity_02NZIZJ8FI8NP5hCWP8YzB37wbDDNLrQflz.output.prompt_response.Select Appliance Version$")
selected_switch_version_id = find_matching_value($activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Switch Available Version Short Names$, $activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Switch Available Version IDs$, "$activity.definition_activity_02NZIZJ8FI8NP5hCWP8YzB37wbDDNLrQflz.output.prompt_response.Select Switch Verision$")
selected_wireless_version_id = find_matching_value($activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Wireless Available Version Short Names$, $activity.definition_activity_02NZO2ATV0TSF6a3nFSu5UNMgFW6sQWt1XZ.output.script_queries.Wireless Available Version IDs$, "$activity.definition_activity_02NZIZJ8FI8NP5hCWP8YzB37wbDDNLrQflz.output.prompt_response.Select Wireless Verision$")

actions.title: Check the Network for the current firmware versions

properties.description: Check each network for the current firmware version and compare that to the selected firmware version to determine if the firmware upgrade is required.  The Update firmware version activity will fail if the current version is same as the selected version, which could happen if the current version is the only available version.

blocks.name: Condition Branch
blocks.title: At least one Upgrade is required

properties.description: Check if any of the boolean values are true indicating that at least one firmware version upgrade is required.
properties.display_name: At least one Upgrade is required

properties.description:
Use the Update Network Firmware Upgrades activity and pass the local variables for the upgrade firmware version IDs.  NOTE: The Upgrade version IDs will be null if no upgrade for that product is required based upon the previous workflow logic that checks the current version IDs
To add support for new product types, just map in the new Upgrade version ID variables
NOTE: This activity has the Continue workflow execution on failure option selected so the workflow will continue to run should a single network upgrade action fail
Check the result for the preceding Update Network Firmware Upgrades activity
The Upgrade activity was successful if the status code returned is 200
Add the Network Name to the list of Networks that were successfully scheduled for the firmware upgrade.
The Upgrade activity failed if the status code returned is not 200

Add the Network Name to the list of Networks that were not scheduled for a firmware upgrade.
NOTE: In this conditional branch would be a good place for an action to open a ticket in ServiceNow, or take some other action to generate an alert about a network firmware upgrade schedule error
If all the boolean values are false, then none of the products on this Network required an upgrade
The Network did not require an Upgrade so add it to the Upgrade Not required list
Reset the loop variables for the next iteration
Format the Output status message
